summary: This document is an email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, primarily concerning travel approval and logistics for a team conducting interviews related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The chain details planning for a trip to Stockholm, Sweden, in late January/early February 2020, and references several prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Coordinates travel logistics, including hotel and flight bookings, for the prosecution team working on the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The official who grants approval for travel requests and associated expenses for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on the travel approval email; part of the office staff involved in the Epstein case logistics.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Frequently copied on travel request emails for the Epstein investigation, indicating involvement in the case or team logistics.

connections.description: Alleyne submits travel logistics and cost overages for Tyrrell's approval, and Tyrrell grants formal travel authorization.
Both are copied on internal emails coordinating travel for the Epstein investigation team.
Duncan is consistently copied on travel approval requests sent to Tyrrell for the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The prosecution team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requested travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Formal travel request approved for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the case 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618'.

keyFacts: The document reveals active investigation travel by the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office for the Epstein case (2018R01618) into early 2020, including an international trip to Sweden.
Travel requests consistently reference the need for hotel conference rooms to conduct interviews, indicating formal interview settings were being arranged.
The email chain shows a pattern of domestic travel to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach for 'victim interviews' throughout 2019.
The case is formally referred to as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Several key individuals (prosecutors/investigators) are redacted in the emails, but their involvement in the travel and interviews is clear from the context.
